results.title: The Blue streak rocket
results.creator_credit: George Grafton Green and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Blue Streak Rocket is the first stage in the development of a rocket which will help boost a one ton satellite, of the European Launcher Development Organisation, into orbit three hundred miles high. Shows the static test in England and the launching at Woomera.

results.title: Children of the Musgraves (A)
results.creator_credit: Edmee Campbell-Dobbie, J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: Filmed at Ernabella Mission Station in the Musgrave Ranges, 1000 miles north of Adelaide. Shows the life of Aborigines, their schooling and play, and their assimilation to white Australian ways. They are also given time each day to follow their own cultural traditions of hunting and cooking. Narrated by J.J. Hume.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmee Campbell-Dobbie, J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films

results.title: Flame of Persia
results.brief_description: A historical, geographical and descriptive account of Persia/Iran including the celebration of 25 centuries of monarchy. Depicts the Shah of Iran discussing Persian industry and pride. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Bitter Herbs and Honey
results.creator_credit: Monique Schwarz, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Amber Films
results.brief_description: Australian documentary focuses on the lives of European Jews who settled in the Melbourne suburb of Carlton in the 1940s, fleeing World War II atrocities and post-War conditions. Interestingly the Jews from Eastern Europe clashed with Anglo-Jews, settled in the nineteenth century, who identified as British rather than Jewish and disapproved of the too obvious presence of Sephardic Jews, with whom they feared association. Despite these and other difficulties, social groups thrived in the suburb, where people shared life, food, religion and a common experience. Local residents from the period, many recalling their childhood, discuss a marvellously rich and joyous, if impoverished, family life; others talk about the racism suffered at school and in the street; several recount the pain of being a Holocaust survivor and the trials of assimilation. Includes archival footage from the era interspersed with recreations and a slew of interviews that include: Pinchus Ringelblum, Hilary Rubinstein, Bernard Rechter, Solomon Pose, Victor Smorgon, Arnord Zable, Jean Holkner, June Factor, Freydi Mrocki, Sam Lipski, Amirah Inglis, Rachel Levita and Miriam Kuna. Features some marvellous Yiddish songs and several interviewees discuss their parents yearning to sustain the use of Yiddish language. With occasional English subtitles.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 3
results.brief_description: Fly fishermen perfect their art for annual assault on trout streams - skill in manipulating the finely woollen line is acquired only after years of patient practice; Australian National Airways take delivery of newest DC-6B airline ‘Beltana’ (arrival at Essendon Airport); Hakoah force Moreland to replay in exciting Dockerty Cup semi-final (soccer).

results.title: Bushland fantasy
results.creator_credit: Soundmasters and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the many wild flowers and animals found in the Australian bush. Includes photographs of native flora, and animal life such as kangaroos, wallabies, platypus, lyrebirds and koalas. Many of these can be found in the wildlife sanctuary at Healesville where special efforts are made to arrange a proper diet for these animals. Narrated by John Dudley.

results.title: Boys and Balls
results.creator_credit: Sue Thomson, Anna Grieve, Thermal Falls, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gil Scrine Films
results.brief_description: It is in games many men discover their paradise. Robert Lynd. H.G. Nelson (Greig Pickhaver) and Rampaging Roy Slaven (John Doyle) host an amusing, often hilarious exploration of the fascination of men with balls; whether it is a cricket, football, tennis, basketball, soccer, bowls, table tennis, hockey or golf ball! Celebrities including Ted Whitten, Ron Barassi, Merv Hughes, Derek Kickett, Andrew Gaze, Lindsay Gaze, Francis Awaritife, Brad Mackay, Greg Champion and the average bloke and kid next door share favourite childhood memories of their sporting idols, humerous moments, coaching temperaments, the importance of rules and umpiring, and the incidence of sporting violence. Interviews, archival footage and famous quotes are intermixed in this perceptive program.

results.title: The Greatest Art Movement: Transporting Art: the Story of Melbourne's Art Trams
results.creator_credit: Michael Buckley, National Heart Foundation of Australia. Victorian Division and Arts Victoria
results.brief_description: Trams have always been a feature of Melbourne life and they have now been transformed into moving art galleries. Melbourne’s Transporting Art Project involves a new series of decorated trams. Several of the artists discuss their reasons for taking part in the scheme, the themes behind their work and the unusual medium. Artists include Aleks Danko, Philip Faulks, Lin Onus, Terry Matassoni, Jenny Watson and Brett Colquhoun.
results.title_for_label: The Greatest Art Movement: Transporting Art: the Story of Melbourne’s Art Trams
